intro: Humboltia chrysantha, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer and early fall. It has a shrub-like growth habit with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Humboltia chrysantha is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
